channel.title: ::pnpc wont work on my server. Help please?
channel.description:
I figured out that if i use the ghost emote that makes you have 50% opacity and if you where ghostly robes, It gives you the cloaking effect like on Halo... But out off all the things the most simple command that comes with every server, ::pnpc DOES NOT WORK! I have no clue why it wont work on pimpscape, I have two pimpscape servers and one of them pnpc does work because i have a command that turns you into santa...
Can anyone help me with this? I really wanna make phantom wars on my server :|[br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2007, 02:16:02 AM[/size][hr]All I want is for ::pnpc to work. It seems like the command itself is working because if I type ::pnpc with no npc ID it says Wrong Syntax! But if I try it with the number... for example ::pnpc 767, I should turn into a crate... Nothing happens when I do that... So I have no clue whats going on and I really want to fix this! :confused:[br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2007, 03:08:43 AM[/size][hr]...[br][size=1]Posted on: April 10, 2007, 01:44:44 PM[/size][hr] :| Does no one like helping me?

item.source: ::pnpc wont work on my server. Help please?

item.title: ::pnpc wont work on my server. Help please?
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

Search for

pnpc

and replace what you see with

if (command.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights >= 3) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5)); if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) { npcId = newNPC; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }
This is taken directly from my Pimpscape. It’s unaltered.

Read full topic

item.title: ::pnpc wont work on my server. Help please?
item.dc:creator: @Muffinator Muffinator
item.description:
@Muffinator wrote:

::pnpc stands for playable npc… Basicly ::pnpc 0 turns you into Hans. But the command does not work for me for some reason. It acts like it wants to work but it cant. Because if I type ::pnpc 767 which would turn me into a crate, nothing happens. But if I just type ::pnpc with no number, It says Wrong Syntax!
